result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfonzo Ray Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence being served at time of revocation

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Prescriptions to be filled by one pharmacy to obtain medications.
*Sign releases for agent to monitor medications.
*Provide list of medications to agent. 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfonzo Ray Diaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alfonzo Ray Diaz in court with attorney William Robert Kerner. Atty Louis Molepske appearing for Elizabeth R. Constable on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.

11:08 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Kerner states a clarification in regards to the complaint.
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kerner makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.
Atty Molepske clarifies jail sentence/probation on the record. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to any other sentence being served at time of revocation
*1 day jail credit
**If probation revoked - huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow

Placed on Probation for a period of 12 months:
**Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs - Drug Abuse Surcharge and DNA Surcharge 
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Prescriptions to be filled by one pharmacy to obtain medications.
*Sign releases for agent to monitor medications.
*Provide list of medications to the agent.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample

Prior: 2950 Plover Springs Dr, Apt #1, Plover, WI 54467 United States

records.addlTxt:
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cass Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of:
(Kohl Baker - Possession w/ Intent to Deliver-LSD, Possession of Controlled Substance in Jail,  Resisting/Obstructing an Officer, Bail Jumping)
(Elizabeth Brilowski - Possession w/ Intent to Deliver-LSD, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia)
(Alfonso Diaz - Possession of LSD-2nd offense, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia)
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. Defendant is on probation and has a PO hold. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/2/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Do not possess/consume any controlled substance.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming any controlled substances.
